Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2010 05:13PM irish47 wrote: Good luck to you both on your results.. I too found the waiting terrible and strangly, once I was diagnosed felt better somehow.  I think I found the certainty easier to handle than the is it/isn't it situation.  hopefully the results will be benign.
Posts.Title: hate the wait hipjo76 mollymo25

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2010 11:07AM irish47 wrote: Hi and sorry to hear about your diagnosis. You have taken a good step in posting on here, you will get lots of advice and support. Take a deep breath, then read as much as you can and learn as much as you can so that you can make all those important decisions in the following weeks and months.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed & Overwhelmed VRamos bogdany22

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 03:02AM irish47 wrote: From one Irish person who should be in bed.. 'May the road rise with you, may the wind be always at your back, and may God hold you in the hollow of His hand.' God bless all.
